list_definition.definition: to do something with or for someone that he cannot do alone, or that he will find useful

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Will you help me with this translation?
Will you please help me (to) translate this poem?
He fell down and I helped him up.

list_definition.definition: to play a part in something; to improve or advance

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Bright posters will help to attract the public to the exhibition
Good exam results will help his chances of a job.
An aspirin will help your headache.

list_definition.definition: to serve (a person) in a shop

list_definition.mean_english: không thể ngăn chặn hoặc tránh được cái gì
list_definition.definition: (with can(not), could (not)) to be able not to do something or to prevent something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He looked so funny that I couldn’t help laughing
Can I help it if it rains?

list_definition.mean_english: sự giúp đỡ hoặc được giúp đỡ
list_definition.definition: the act of helping, or the result of this

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Can you give me some help?
Your digging the garden was a big help
Can I be of help to you?

list_definition.mean_english: người giúp đỡ; vật giúp ích
list_definition.definition: someone or something that is useful

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You’re a great help to me.
She has hired a new help.

list_definition.definition: (usually with no) a way of preventing something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Even if you don’t want to do it, the decision has been made – there’s no help for it now.

list_ex_of_english: The risk is that clinicians increasingly will be reluctant to do quite ordinary procedures to help patients because of existing guidelines.
Their claim that higher levels of unemployment help extreme right parties is valid given their model.
These improvements could also complement and even enhance the benefits of drugs that help with the symptoms of dementia.
You told him that you would help him with writing.
This first synthesis in turn helped in the production of a more perspicuous analysis, with a more satisfactory synthesis.
Many people with symptoms of psychological distress do not seek professional help.
They were explicitly told that some of the characters have features that could help them choose and some did not.
Second, physically speaking, patients are usually helped in any such transfer by a nurse, a doctor, or one of the patient's relatives.
